node.title: ‘Torn’ Review: A Climber’s Son Explores His Father’s Legacy
node.description: This documentary on the life and death of the mountaineer Alex Lowe demonstrates how unexpected bonds can form around those in grief.

node.title: Omicron Has Lessons for Us. We Refuse to Learn Them.
node.description: The response to a new variant of the coronavirus suggests a teachable epoch gone to waste.

node.title: A Car a Minute Used to Flow Through Here, but Chaos Now Reigns
node.description: A shipping terminal in Kansas reveals the fundamental problem — no one can plan, and no one is sure what will happen next.

node.title: Hochul urges attendees at anime conference in N.Y.C. to get tested after Omicron connection emerges.
node.description: “This is not cause for alarm,” Gov. Kathy Hochul said. “It was foreseen ever since it was first reported out of South Africa, that we knew it would come to New York State at some point.”

node.title: Another Omicron case is detected in the U.S., this time in a Minnesota resident who had traveled to N.Y.C.
node.description: Officials said they found the virus variant in a test sample from a man who had recently traveled to New York City for Anime NYC 2021 convention at the Javits Center.

node.title: Elon Musk's Sold-Out Cyberwhistles Selling for Hundreds of Dollars on eBay
node.description: The whistles were originally on sale for $50 on the Tesla website, as Musk poked fun at whistleblowers and Apple's $19 polishing cloth.

node.title: Customers, Employees Spend Night Watching TV, Sleeping in Ikea After Snowstorm Traps Them
node.description: The store's manager said that the stranded group of people were able to "pick the exact bed they always have wanted to try."

node.title: Missouri Health Department Reportedly Withheld Info That Mask Mandates Work, Records Show
node.description: A series of emails were exchanged that included the information and data, but it was never released to the public.

node.title: Christmas Trees, Both Real and Fake, Costing Up to 30 Percent More This Year
node.description: Extreme weather and supply chain problems have caused the trees to rise in price this holiday season.

node.title: Russia Could Take Legal Action Against NASA Astronaut Accused of Drilling Hole in Spacecraft
node.description: In 2018 a 2-millimeter hole was discovered in the Russian Soyuz spacecraft docked at the ISS. Russian authorities have passed the results of an investigation to law enforcement.

node.title: Stacey Abrams' Chances of Winning Georgia 2022 Governor Race, According to Bookmakers
node.description: Abrams, who served as a member of the Georgia House of Representatives between 2007 and 2017, narrowly lost to Brian Kemp in 2018, by about 55,000 votes.

node.title: United Nations on Lockdown as Man With Firearm Paces Outside New York Headquarters
node.description: The NYPD spokesperson told Newsweek that NYPD officers were "trying to develop a dialogue" with the man.

node.title: 'Amazon Has My Back': Encounter Between Delivery Driver and Man Viewed 22M Times
node.description: "He was walking in the house and said, that is the weirdest thing that's ever happened to me!" the TikToker wrote.

node.title: Out-of-Stock Messages Up 258 Percent This Holiday Season Compared to November 2019
node.description: The shortages will not just leave customers without the specific products they want, but could hurt smaller retailers and bring down total holiday sales.

node.title: Woman in Rural Alaska Reveals Shocking Prices of Grocery Items in Video Viewed 2M Times
node.description: "$25 for cheese," wrote one stunned commenter regarding the high grocery prices. "I think I'd just buy a cow."

node.title: Internet Backs Woman Who Caught Ex Cheating, Outed Him as Gay to Fundamentalist MIL
node.description: "I will never forgive him for leading me on so he could use me to have kids, so it's over, end of story," the post read.

node.title: NZ Bus testing markets for potential buyers
node.description: Transport company NZ Bus is on the sales block, according to overseas media reports.

node.title: 29 World Cup games to be played in New Zealand
node.description: Football fans around the country will get 29 opportunities to see the best players in the game on show during the 2023 Women's World Cup.

node.title: Unvaccinated private boat owners a risk to Aotea's community - iwi
node.description: Locals on Aotea Great Barrier Island are worried about the impact holiday travellers will have on the community when the country moves into the traffic light system tomorrow.

node.title: What happened to the perfect child?
node.description: More than 20 years ago, a Russian girl was adopted by a young American couple who eventually brought her back to Moscow after her parents say she tried to kill her baby brother.

node.title: Ocean plastic pollution is being colonized by coastal species
node.description: Researchers still have questions about these new plastic-living communities, but the discovery could change ocean ecosystems on a global scale.

node.title: Second U.S. case of Omicron spotted in Minnesota, after NYC travel
node.description: The Minnesota man attended a convention where organizers had apologized to 53,000 attendees for long lines.

node.title: An ad with a vaccinated Santa that drew 5,000 complaints is cleared by British regulators.
node.description: The commercial, for the supermarket chain Tesco, depicted Santa Claus being cleared to travel.

node.title: On the Market in New York City
node.description: This week’s properties are in Dumbo, Chelsea and on the Upper West Side.

node.title: Homes for Sale in New York and New Jersey
node.description: This week’s homes are a five-bedroom homes in Oyster Bay Cove, N.Y., and Cherry Hill, N.J.

node.title: Lloyd Austin Says China Increasing Tensions in Asia by Testing Hypersonic Weapons
node.description: The U.S. defense secretary said he was concerned about China's testing of the weapons.

node.title: In Wake of Oxford School Shooting, Parkland Survivor Opens Up About His Regrets
node.description: Cameron Kasky reflected on the key role he's taken on in the youth-led movement on gun violence prevention, writing "I wish I could have done it all right."

node.title: Videos Found on Ethan Crumbley's Phone 'Horrendously Disturbing,' Oakland Co. Sheriff Says
node.description: During Crumbley's arraignment police said they found a journal in his backpack "detailing his desire to shoot up a school to include murdering students."

node.title: Migrants in Detention Centers Have Increased More Rhan 55 Percent Since Biden Took Office
node.description: About 77 percent of those in detention were arrested by U.S. Customs and Border Protection while 23 percent were apprehended by ICE, according to Syracuse University's TRAC.

node.title: Willis promises to be balancing force as National's new deputy leader
node.description: National's new deputy leader Nicola Willis says she brings a centrist, moderate perspective of a parent of four, along with a familiarity with Parliament that balances out the new leader.
